Flexibilität – Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du bei uns - in Abstimmung mit den betrieblichen Anforderungen und arbeitsrechtlichen Bestimmungen - selber bestimmen. Dabei gibt es keine Kernarbeitszeiten und du hast die Möglichkeit, im Home Office sowie in über 40 Ländern zu arbeiten.

Masterförderung – Durch unsere interne Academy, internationale Erfahrungen durch Secondments und kontinuierliches Mentoring entwickelst du dich stetig weiter. Darüber hinaus bieten wir die Möglichkeit einer Masterförderung für Examensmaster und Spezialisierungsmaster an.

Freizeit – Dank eines Teilzeit-Blockmodells kannst du auch mehrmonatige Auszeiten in Form eines Sabbaticals nehmen. Zusätzlich kannst du bei PwC Deutschland Überstunden auf einem persönlichen Jahresarbeitszeitskonto sammeln. Deine Überstunden kannst du im Laufe des Jahres durch Freizeit ausgleichen. Restliche Überstunden werden einmal jährlich ausgezahlt.

Gesundheit – Deine Gesundheit liegt uns am Herzen: Neben einer eigenen betrieblichen Krankenkasse bieten wir auch Vorsorgeuntersuchungen sowie Sportangebote an. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von vergünstigten Beiträgen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

Das ist noch nicht alles – Wir möchten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten möglich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

 

 

Bei PwC Deutschland arbeiten wir daran, entscheidende Herausforderungen zu lösen, nachhaltige Ergebnisse zu schaffen und das Vertrauen in die Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft auszubauen. Als Teil unseres Finance Transformation Teams unterstützt du Unternehmen dabei, ihre Finanzabteilung zu einem noch stärkeren Businesspartner zu machen und so die Wettbewerbsfähigkeit des gesamten Unternehmens schneller voranzutreiben. Dabei ist unser Themenspektrum breit: Von CFO-Strategie über Process Excellence, ERP-Systemen, Quality Assurance, Compliance und Data Management. Dabei stellen wir als integriertes Finance Transformation-Team das reibungslose Ineinandergreifen aller Teilprojekte entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette sicher.

 

Kontakt

Du hast Fragen zu dieser Position oder deiner Bewerbung?

Melde dich gerne bei Theresa Volders unter +49 1515 4092298.

Title: Senior Applied Statistician
HTML:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 160 employees across more than 30 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

We are looking for an in-house Senior Applied Statistician to assist our Programme and Data teams. Across both, we are looking to better understand and explain our data in order to bolster our scientific rigour. You will sit between both teams and should be confident working with different types of statistical analysis, process-based modelling, and sampling/stratification.

Equally, you should have a good understanding of statistical modelling and bring a fresh perspective to our machine learning and process-based approaches. Thus, you will be a strong communicator capable of translating complex analysis into simplified insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

The Programme and Data teams are integral to the scientific operations of the company, and you will work closely together with them and our Product teams to ensure state of the art science drives our world leading carbon platform. As such, you will be part of a dynamic and high-paced work environment constantly subject to innovation.

How Will You Make An Impact

  • Estimating uncertainty and error propagation in our models;
  • Applying Bayesian methods for the calibration of complex process-based models;
  • Designing sampling strategies for our data collection campaigns;
  • Evaluating the quality and quantity of our data;
  • Communicating and visualising key insights;

Who We’re Looking For

  • Self-driven individual capable of collaborating in a multi-disciplinary environment;
  • Minimum Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, or appropriate science/engineering field;
  • 3+ years of experience working in a relevant field, with experience in some or all of the following:
  • Experience translating statistical models from notation form (e.g. research papers) into clean re-usable code
  • Working with temporal and spatial data;
  • Experience coding in R;
  • Handling unstructured and messy data.
  • Strong scientific writing, report creation and communication skills to audiences with a range of technical expertise.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Masters or PhD in one of the relevant Science fields mentioned above;
  • A baseline understanding of greenhouse gas accounting frameworks and methodologies;
  • Strong theoretical background in Bayesian Statistics;
  • Knowledge or experience working with crop, pedometrics, or process-based models;
  • Experience coding in Python;

What’s In It For You

  • A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
  • A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
  • Competitive compensation package and holidays;
  • Centrally located modern office in Copenhagen or London and the option to work from home a couple days a week;
  • Team events throughout the year;
  • An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
  • Open communication and supportive feedback culture.

🌱 Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

🌍 Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Our Story




At think-cell, we create powerful software solutions that help professionals be more efficient and productive. Founded in 2002 and based in Berlin, our tools integrate seamlessly with Microsoft Office to help users create presentations, charts, and diagrams with ease. Our dynamic, international team values creativity, collaboration, and technical excellence.




How your role will look like:




You collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
You design and implement business logic, data models and visualizations by using various methods and technologies such as SQL, Python and BI tools
You contribute to a valuable, robust and performant data platform by e.g. optimizing code, debugging anomalies and writing documentation




You will be great for this position if you have

At least 8 years of working experience in a Data Analytics environment, ideally in a similar business (Online / eCommerce)
Strong general knowledge of “how to work with data”, e.g. statistical methods, data preparation & visualization, transfer from data via analyses into actionable insights
Advanced data analytics experience with using e.g. Python or R and very good SQL skills
Experience in data modelling and BI-Tool experience, ideally PowerBi and understanding of data architecture concepts
Experience in working with Google Analytics / Matomo data
Experience in Git
Solid understanding of tracking concepts (frontend/backend)
Solid A/B testing experience
Strong ability to work both independent and as a part of the team
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Well structured, detail-oriented working style with a passion for efficient documentation
Desire to succeed as a team by creating synergies over individual success
Capable of outlining and presenting complex issues in an easy-to-understand manner
Great understanding of eCommerce businesses (products & challenges)
Very good language skills in English and optionally also in German




Our Values




As part of our team, you will embody and help shape the following principles that define us:




Forward Thinking: We embrace change and challenge the status quo.
Ownership: We take pride in our work and learn from our mistakes.
Customer First: We prioritize delivering lasting value.
Unified Team: We foster collaboration, respect, and integrity.
Strive for Excellence: We set ambitious goals and pursue quality.




Why is think-cell the right place for you?




We empower over 1.2 million users across 30,000 companies, including top consulting firms and major global enterprises. With offices in Berlin, Denver, Boston, London, Tokyo, and Dubai, we’re a diverse team of over 150 people, committed to innovation and excellence.




Think-cell is more than a job – it's a chance to be part of an innovative, inclusive team that values collaboration and growth. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Together, we can shape the future of productivity software. We can’t wait to see what you’ll bring to the team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
About

At Riverty, we believe that everyone should be in control of their own financial situation. Our shared commitment is to make financial solutions more innovative, empathetic and user-friendly to empower financial growth for everyone. To do this, we rely on 50 years of experience and the commitment of over 5,000 creative minds, innovators and explorers in 11 countries.

Are you ready?

As part of our community, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills and transform the world of finance together with us. We create an environment where you can evolve personally and benefit from our flexible working conditions and work-life balance.

Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.

We are looking for a

Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)

(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our location in Berlin, Verl, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Stockholm – flexible working conditions available

Key Responsibilities

Explore large datasets, evaluate the data quality and model data

Apply statistical methods to understand consumer behavioral patterns relevant for product development and operational efficiency

Analyze problems to understand their root cause

Work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to build and implement analytical solutions

Collaborate on data-related projects

Visualize data and turn data into stories

Derive actionable insights, provide decision support, and make recommendations based on data-driven insights

Consult business units and functional units, such as product or commercial teams in data related questions

Drive, manage and lead data related projects while fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your Profile

5+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis roles within Data & Analytics solutions

Master/MBA degree in numerate subject (e.g. Data Science, Mathematics, Informatics, Economics, Natural Science or Engineering)

Proficient in a programming language such as SQL, Python or R

Experience in cluster analysis, machine learning

Understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation

Advanced in collecting, organizing, analysing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Ability to identify issues, structure and conduct necessary analysis, and draw well-informed conclusions

Consulting skills, especially strong ability to provide insights and recommendations

Extraordinary communication skills to effectively convey complex information and collaborate with diverse teams

Ability to balance multiple priorities, be detail-oriented, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Excellent Team player

Nice If You Have

Experience within the payments, risk, debt collection or factoring space

Experience with modern data stacks, preferably Databricks

Experience in quantitative research

Benefits

Mobile Office: Opportunity to work from home

Discounts & Extras: Exclusive Bertelsmann discounts and financial benefits, e.g., €1,500 referral bonus

Flexible Working Hours and Models: Customize your working hours to suit your needs

Training & Development: A variety of (online) courses, from language learning to leadership training, e.g., from Bertelsmann University

Health & Leisure: Supported sports and (mental) health programs, e.g. from our partner TELUS Health

Appreciative Environment: Diversity and employee networks enrich our culture

#EUR33

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement

We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.

Nice-to-have skills


SQL
Python
R
Machine Learning
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Data Analyst
Data Scientist
IT Consultant


Languages


English
Show more

Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Analyst (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html




Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Almedia is an Ad-Tech company boosting leading brands to engage with broader audiences. Users can enjoy the latest games, apps, and products for rewards.

With our growing community of 35 million users since our launch in 2020, Almedia's Freecash.com is one of the fastest-growing platforms.

Our mission is to create a mutually rewarding experience, where users enjoy great content and advertisers achieve meaningful results.

Join our team as a Senior Data Analyst, where you'll ensure our data is clean, accessible, and ready for analysis. As a core member of our analytics team, you’ll ensure our data infrastructure effectively supports self-service analytics, insightful reporting, and business intelligence across the organization.Apply software engineering practices to analytics code, including version control, testing, and continuous integration.

What You’ll Do 🎯


Design, build, and maintain clean, scalable, and performance-optimized data models using SQL and dbt.
Automate and streamline data validation, testing, and reporting processes.
Take ownership of data analysis for a designated domain, collaborating closely with Product Analysts, Data Scientists, and Business Stakeholders to meet their analytical and reporting needs.
Proactively monitor data integrity, identify issues, and perform root cause analysis.
Maintain comprehensive data documentation and definitions for easy reference and understanding.
Train business users on utilizing the data platform and data visualization tools effectively.


What You’ll Bring 💡


Experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst, or similar role.
Proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker to create insightful dashboards.
Strong experience in data engineering and analytics, with proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and performance optimization.
Knowledge of data validation, testing frameworks, and version control best practices (Git).
Familiarity with modern data stacks (dbt, Snowflake/BigQuery/Redshift, Dagster/Airflow) and cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP).
Excellent communication skills for training and supporting business users.
Ability to maintain detailed data documentation and definitions.


What Makes You a Great Fit 🌟


Passionate about transforming data into actionable insights.
A detail-oriented problem-solver who excels in a collaborative environment.
Eager to innovate and continuously improve data processes.


Why Almedia is your next Big Opportunity? 🚀


Become an owner: As part of our virtual equity option policy, you’ll have the opportunity to share in Almedia’s success and growth.
Innovative and high-growth: Join a startup that has been profitable from day one and is rapidly scaling its impact in the Ad-Tech space.
Collaborative and inclusive culture: Be part of a fast-paced, motivated team of professionals that values feedback and where your contributions truly matter. We embrace diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Berlin office & flexibility: Work in our modern, centrally located space with an office-first culture, while enjoying flexibility when needed, including a work-from-abroad policy to support your personal and professional life balance.


We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth—whether you aspire to be a future leader or a specialist. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer; we embrace and celebrate diversity, encouraging individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Working Student - Data Science (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Working Student to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages cutting-edge technology to develop Machine Learning solutions that optimize our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

As a Working Student in Data Science, you will have the opportunity to work on Machine Learning model improvements and bring them into production. If this sounds exciting, read on!

Job Description


Support the development and improvement of pricing models using both traditional tabular data and deep learning approaches
Carry out data analysis and preparation for machine learning models
Help maintain and optimise existing ML models
Collaborate with the data science team as a whole
Learn and apply best practices in Machine Learning and Data Science


Qualifications


Currently enrolled in or completed university degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related technical field. Students from other degree programmes can also be considered if they have relevant Machine Learning project experience
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation, analysis and ML
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts, previous ML experience or projects is a plus
Good analytical and problem-solving skills and strong English communication skills


Additional Information


International teams
Personal growth with the contribution of own ideas
Exciting team events like Hackathons to foster collaboration and innovation
Join our Early Career Program, get a fair salary and experience our AUTO1 world cross-functionally through special internal events
Be part of Europe's leading digital automotive platform!


Apply by uploading your CV with a note of your earliest starting date.

Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Intern (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.​

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. ​ Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html




Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Mach Daten zur Entscheidungsgrundlage.




DINA entwickelt Technologien für funktionale und Cybersicherheit in Maschinen. Unsere Lösungen sorgen dafür, dass industrielle Systeme zuverlässig, sicher und zukunftsfähig bleiben.

Wir setzen auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen – aber da geht noch mehr. Mit deiner Expertise als Data Analyst (w/m/x) bringst du Struktur in unsere Kundendaten, entwickelst aussagekräftige Analysen und sorgst dafür, dass Daten zum integralen Bestandteil unserer Geschäftsstrategie werden.




Wir arbeiten in einer Holokratie – das bedeutet: keine starren Hierarchien, keine langen Entscheidungswege, sondern Verantwortung von Tag eins an. Wenn du gestalten willst, statt nur zu verwalten, bist du hier richtig.







Deine Aufgaben




Customer Journey Analytics: Du analysierst die gesamte Customer Journey – von Marketing über Sales bis zu Customer Success – und leitest daraus klare Handlungsempfehlungen ab.
Dashboards & Reporting: Du entwickelst Dashboards für Umsatzprognosen, Deal-Pipelines, Marketing-Performance und Kundenzufriedenheit.
Revenue Operations (RevOps): Deine Analysen helfen dabei, Prozesse zu optimieren und datenbasierte Geschäftsentscheidungen zu treffen.
Datenintegration & Engineering: Du optimierst die Anbindung und Nutzung unserer Daten aus CRM (HubSpot) und ERP (SAP Business One).
Preis- & Rabattanalysen: Du erkennst Muster, analysierst Rabattstrukturen und hilfst, die Preisstrategie zu optimieren.
Zukunftsperspektive: Du treibst das Thema Daten in der Organisation voran und hast die Möglichkeit, unser Data-Team mit aufzubauen.







Dein Profil




Analytische Stärke & Business-Sinn – Du verstehst, welche Zahlen wirklich relevant sind und wie man sie sinnvoll nutzt.
Kommerzielles Gespür – Du erkennst, welche datenbasierten Entscheidungen direkten Einfluss auf das Geschäft haben.
Visualisierung – Du bereitest Daten so auf, dass sie sofort verständlich und einprägsam sind.
Storytelling mit Daten – Du kannst aus Zahlen eine klare, überzeugende Geschichte machen, die Entscheidungen vorantreibt.
Eigenverantwortung & Proaktivität – Du wartest nicht auf Aufgaben, sondern siehst, was getan werden muss – und setzt es um.
Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse – 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung mit SQL, idealerweise ergänzt durch Tableau, Power BI oder Looker.
Technisches Verständnis – Du kannst mit APIs umgehen und hast Grundkenntnisse in der Datenintegration.
Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe – Du kannst mit Sales, Marketing und Management sprechen – und bringst deine Analysen auf den Punkt.







Das bekommst du von uns




Täglicher Team-Lunch – Dein Mittagessen geht auf uns.
Firmenfitness – Zugang zu Gympass, Wellpass oder Urban Sports.
Weiterbildung & Coaching – Dein Budget für Schulungen & Konferenzen.
Ausstattung nach Wahl – Laptop, Monitor & Headset nach deinen Bedürfnissen.
Mehr Eigenverantwortung – Entscheidungen treffen, statt auf Vorgaben warten.
Klare Rollen & Transparenz – Jeder weiß, wer wofür verantwortlich ist.
Gestaltungsspielraum – Deine Ideen bewegen etwas – in Prozessen, Strategie & Technologie.
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit – Arbeiten in Kreisen, nicht in Abteilungen.
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge – 40 € VWL + 25 € Zuschuss von uns.
Team-Workshops & Offsites – Zweimal im Jahr gemeinsame Strategie & Weiterentwicklung.
Flexibel & agil – Deine Rolle wächst mit dir, nicht umgekehrt.




Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We’re proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities


Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.


How You Will Contribute


Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value


By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile


5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.


We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer


100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application <3

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About This Position

Are you passionate about turning raw data into strategic insights that drive business success? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you have the autonomy to shape and scale data infrastructure?

Then heyData is your next stop!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing our data infrastructure, developing scalable data models, and providing actionable insights to teams across the company. You'll ensure data-driven decision-making and foster a data-first culture.

Your mission


Manage & Optimize BI Infrastructure: Own and maintain our end-to-end BI setup, which currently includes Airbyte, dbt, Snowflake, and Metabase. Continuously evaluate and implement the best tools to meet our evolving needs.
Develop Scalable Data Models: Build and maintain reliable, scalable data models that ensure data integrity and accuracy across all business functions.
Drive Strategic Insights: Analyze business performance metrics, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to leadership and various teams.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand data needs and support data-driven decision-making.
Mentorship & Alignment: Upskill junior team members and ensure that data strategies align with the company’s vision and goals.
Ensure Data Governance: Implement and uphold data governance policies and industry best practices to maintain compliance and security.


What we are looking for?


5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.).
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, or similar.
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into meaningful business insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with dbt is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment is a plus.


Why heyData?


Join a fast-growing startup on a mission to become a leader in compliance.
Clear career development opportunities and the chance to take ownership from day one, with a flexible learning budget.
Work alongside a highly motivated team with backgrounds in top-tier consulting, startups, venture capital, and law firms.
Flexible working options: Whether in our beautiful office in the heart of Berlin-Mitte or remote – work in the way that suits you best.
Team events and culture: Regular events in Berlin and exciting team offsites.
State-of-the-art IT equipment, 30 days of annual leave, and attractive benefits such as support for the Deutschlandticket, Urban Sports Club membership, or a company pension plan.


About Us

At heyData, we are determined to serve our mission: making Compliance easy for everybody!

At heyData, we're not just a company; we're a movement. We're reshaping the way small and medium-sized businesses embrace compliance. We set up European employees on track to reach compliance in the fastest, most intuitive, and seamless way possible. Think of us as the superheroes of compliance, and we've only just begun. With over one thousand customers we are one of the largest SMB compliance platforms in Europe and are expanding further.

But here's the real kicker – you get to learn from a world-class team across Europe and contribute to a game-changing compliance solution that's set to revolutionize millions of SMBs. So, are you ready to be part of this incredible journey and do the most exciting work of your life? Let's make compliance history together! #heyDataLife

If the idea of making an impact excites you as much as it does us, then heyData is where you belong. This is your chance to leap into the adventure of a lifetime and set your career on fire! Reach out to us, and let's blaze a trail together in the world of business innovation! #JoinheyData

At heyData, we're proud to be a vibrant and diverse startup. We celebrate and embrace people from all backgrounds, including diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status parental status, and more to apply to our roles. Our team thrives on the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone can succeed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Do you think in data, recognize patterns where others only see numbers, and turn complex analyses into clear recommendations for action? Then you’ve come to the right place! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will take our data-driven decision-making to the next level with precise analyses and smart dashboards – creating real value for our company.







These tasks await you here:




Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports to support essential decision-making processes
Analyze internal and external data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization
Ensure data integrity and guarantee that all BI tools provide reliable and accurate information
Define and implement KPI-driven success metrics to evaluate the performance of our business processes
Collaborate closely with various departments (Operations, Finance, Sales, Real Estate Management) to develop and enhance data-driven solutions
Support colleagues in effectively using BI tools and foster a data-driven mindset within the company




Your profile:




A degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role
Strong expertise in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, dashboard development) and Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, data analysis tools, preferably macos)
Experience with SQL, APIs, ERP/CRM systems, ETL processes, and Data Warehousing is a plus – particularly in handling structured and unstructured data from diverse sources and integrating them into powerful BI systems
Knowledge of real estate market data and relevant KPIs is an advantage
Excellent English skills, ideally also German skills




This is what you can expect from us:




Learning Effects and Responsibility: A role with diverse tasks, a high degree of creative freedom, and ample opportunities for self-fulfillment
Teamwork & Diversity: Amazing team members you can rely on. We recognize the benefits of diverse teams and an inclusive corporate culture, which is why fostering diversity is a key part of our corporate strategy for the future
International Collaboration: Work alongside motivated colleagues in growing international teams
Personal Development: With a personalized development plan and continuous training, you’ll achieve your goals with us
Security: A permanent employment contract and a competitive salary package, including an annual bonus and regular salary adjustments
Leisure: 30 vacation days per year, plus additional special leave on December 24th and 31st
Fun and Benefits: Regular team events and workshops, as well as employee discounts
Show more
HTML:
Do you think in data, recognize patterns where others only see numbers, and turn complex analyses into clear recommendations for action? Then you’ve come to the right place! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will take our data-driven decision-making to the next level with precise analyses and smart dashboards – creating real value for our company.



These tasks await you here:


  • Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports to support essential decision-making processes
  • Analyze internal and external data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization
  • Ensure data integrity and guarantee that all BI tools provide reliable and accurate information
  • Define and implement KPI-driven success metrics to evaluate the performance of our business processes
  • Collaborate closely with various departments (Operations, Finance, Sales, Real Estate Management) to develop and enhance data-driven solutions
  • Support colleagues in effectively using BI tools and foster a data-driven mindset within the company


Your profile:


  • A degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field
  • 2-5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role
  • Strong expertise in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, dashboard development) and Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, data analysis tools, preferably macos)
  • Experience with SQL, APIs, ERP/CRM systems, ETL processes, and Data Warehousing is a plus – particularly in handling structured and unstructured data from diverse sources and integrating them into powerful BI systems
  • Knowledge of real estate market data and relevant KPIs is an advantage
  • Excellent English skills, ideally also German skills


This is what you can expect from us:


  • Learning Effects and Responsibility: A role with diverse tasks, a high degree of creative freedom, and ample opportunities for self-fulfillment
  • Teamwork & Diversity: Amazing team members you can rely on. We recognize the benefits of diverse teams and an inclusive corporate culture, which is why fostering diversity is a key part of our corporate strategy for the future
  • International Collaboration: Work alongside motivated colleagues in growing international teams
  • Personal Development: With a personalized development plan and continuous training, you’ll achieve your goals with us
  • Security: A permanent employment contract and a competitive salary package, including an annual bonus and regular salary adjustments
  • Leisure: 30 vacation days per year, plus additional special leave on December 24th and 31st
  • Fun and Benefits: Regular team events and workshops, as well as employee discounts

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At Entyre, our mission is to reduce both under and over-provision of healthcare through the intelligent combination of human expertise and technology. Our dedicated care consultants work tirelessly on an international level, supported by our proprietary software solutions.

We believe that individuals in need of care, who are looked after by their relatives at home, have the right to live a self-determined and dignified life in their own homes. With our brands Pflegewegweiser and Entyre Care, we are committed to achieving this goal by focusing on two central pillars: providing professional support to caregiving relatives in all areas of home care with our extensive expertise and ensuring fair monetary compensation for their efforts. We are also driving the development of innovative solutions in collaboration with scientific partners.

In this vital, dynamic, and international environment, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to join our team in Berlin.







Key Responsibilities

Develop data models with DBT on DataBricks for marketing, sales and operations
Develop optimized SQL queries to aggregate and explore data from multiple datasets, identify opportunities and limitations within our data sets and deliver reliable and high quality analysis to drive strategic insights.
Translate complex data insights into compelling narratives that drive action across marketing and leadership teams.
Enable teams with self-service analytics by maintaining curated data sources and developing automated, scalable dashboards by applying intuitive data visualization and dashboard design best practices.
Own key projects and respond to ad-hoc data requests from internal and external stakeholders. Define, calculate, and validate key performance metrics (KPIs), identifying automation opportunities and developing self-service analytics solutions.
Communicate with stakeholders on various projects to gather requirements, collect feedback and present deliverables to achieve expected outcomes.
Brainstorm creative solutions to exploratory projects built around ambiguity, including running analysis to identify problems, understand root cause of trends, provide actionable insights and recommend solutions.
Work collaboratively and cross functionally with other members of the data team to support testing/experimentation, data modeling, data visualization & data science.
Collaborate with data scientists to leverage A/B testing and incrementality analysis to measure marketing effectiveness and optimize campaign performance.




Value Proposition

Make a Life-Changing Impact: Your analyses will directly contribute to improving the lives of millions. You will play a crucial role in helping low-income families access quality homecare.
Personal Growth and Learning Opportunities: Join a vibrant, dedicated team and contribute to building the next industry-defining company. You’ll gain exposure to various aspects of the business while expanding your skills.
Energizing & Flat Hierarchy Team Culture: We care deeply about one another and are committed to collaboration and teamwork. You’ll have the autonomy to drive your initiatives and make a meaningful impact.




Hard Requirements

Minimum of 4 years of experience in growth marketing analytics, data science, preferably in direct-to-consumer and e-commerce companies.
Experience with marketing analytics, attribution modelling, customer segmentation, and predictive modelling for growth and retention.
Expertise in SQL and proficiency in either Python (or R) for advanced data analysis and automation. Experience with dbt, Looker, or other modern analytics tools is a plus.
Familiarity with B2C acquisition and subscription marketing concepts and metrics, including customer journeys, conversion funnels and critical reporting (CAC, payback, retention rate, etc.).
Hands-on experience working with structured and unstructured data in cloud-based environments, like Databricks, BigQuery etc.
Comfortable navigating large datasets, acquiring and cleansing data from multiple sources.
Demonstrates intellectual curiosity, a self-motivated approach to problem-solving, and a passion for continuous learning and improvement.
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to be a self starter and work independently.
Advanced data visualization skills
Familiarity with marketing, CRM, social and ad platforms, such as HubSpot, Google Ads, Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok and others. Experience with partnership and affiliate marketing is a plus.
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into business-friendly insights.
Ability to collaborate with partners to document key business needs into a clearly defined requirements document and project plan.
Proven skills in distilling complex topics into easy to understand data visualizations. Advanced Tableau data visualization skills preferred.







Soft Requirements

Passionate and Impact-Driven: You thrive in fast-paced environments and are eager to contribute to transformational change in the healthcare industry.
Strategic Thinker: You have strong strategic thinking abilities combined with a hands-on execution mindset. You understand the importance of data in driving marketing initiatives.
Detail-Oriented: Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in data analysis and reporting.
Open-Minded and Team Player: You enjoy collaborating with others and have a willingness to learn and adapt. You view challenges as opportunities for growth and innovation.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in redefining homecare!

Show more

Title: BI-Consultant (m/w/d) - Remote oder Berlin
Description:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.




Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.




Was wir Dir bieten:




Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.




Was Du mitbringst:




Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.




Interesse?




Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Show more

Title: Analytics Team Lead (all genders)
Description:
What To Expect

Caspar Health is the digital rehabilitation clinic with the vision of giving every patient access to the most effective rehabilitation treatment anywhere at any time. We provide individual, digital therapy combined with personal therapeutic care from healthcare professionals. This is your opportunity to help shape traditional healthcare concepts in the areas of prevention and rehabilitation so that people receive the best possible care during and after their clinic stay, regardless of their location.

We're looking for an experienced Analytics Team Lead (all genders) to guide and empower our team of Data Analysts at Caspar. In this role, you'll blend hands-on analytical work with leadership responsibilities, providing insights and driving initiatives that directly impact our business strategy through both your team and your personal contributions. You will be instrumental in leading and mentoring the team, cultivating a collaborative environment, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality, actionable analytics that drive business decisions

Your Challenges

You Will Be


leading, mentoring and developing a team of four data analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth
providing context and guidance to both your team and to external stakeholders, so that projects can be executed seamlessly
leveraging data insights to proactively identify and drive cross-functional initiatives aimed at improving business outcomes
conceptualizing and evaluating new data architectures, structures and their relationships for complex analysis.
maintaining and improving automation and pipelines design
communicating with key stakeholders to develop dashboards and analysis that can be used to make business-critical decisions.
providing quality assurance of data, working with various departments to ensure accuracy and consistency.


Your profile


You bring at least 2 years of experience as a hands-on Team Lead Data Analyst or in a related role
You love to proactively find problems to tackle and propose solutions for them
You recognize the importance of making sure your team members are happy and have space and time to develop
You have experience / education in the area of data analysis or a degree in a related field (informatics, maths, science etc.)
You are a strong analytical thinker and problem solver
You have a high attention to detail
You can work independently
You are a strong team player and enjoy working in a team
You are a motivated and fast learner
You have strong communication skills


You Have Profound Knowledge Of And Practical Experience In


SQL (Snowflake Preferred)
Data visualisation (Tableau preferred)


Ideally, You Also Already Gained Experience With


The German healthcare sector
German as a language (the working language would still be English)
ELT/ETL processes (DBT preferred)
predictive modelling
A/B testing
product analytics
Python
Git
ML and Data Science


Why Caspar Health?


Looking for commitment? Perfect match! We offer a permanent employment contract.
You don't want to just be a number? Understandable. With us, the human-being is the focus. Every Casparian* can participate in diversity and inclusion initiatives and thus actively contribute to our work culture.
You appreciate feedback? We're happy to hear that. We encourage an open feedback culture to learn and grow together.
You value a good work-life balance? So do we, and that's why we offer flexible working hours, mobile working, also outside of Germany, and various models for part-time work.
You want to develop yourself continuously? With an individual plan and bi-annual development talks we pursue your next career steps together.
You value your health? So do we! We offer weekly, varied sports sessions that are also streamed to your home office. Plus, as a Casparian*, you can take advantage of our health app with mental health-, exercise -, and nutrition modules for free.
Of course, we also offer fresh fruit and a variety of healthy snacks and drinks in our beautiful office in the heart of Berlin.


Diversity And Inclusion

At Caspar Health, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for all Casparians* regardless of ethnic origin, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations of any kind, physical appearance, social background, age or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we purely focus on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (picture, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc). We value and treat all applications equally.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

Your contact

Dana Kussatz; Talent Acquisition Specialist & HR Business Partner

Please submit your application online. We are also interested in knowing your earliest possible start date and your salary expectations. If you have further questions please reach out to talent@caspar-health.com. We will get in touch with you as soon as we can.

Our product CASPAR Health is used in the environment of medical institutions, patients, doctors and therapists. Working with (sensitive) personal data (e.g. health data) is part of our daily work. Therefore, we require a high level of commitment to the protection of personal data from our employees in order to protect the rights of the data subjects as best as possible.

Note On Data Protection

Please apply exclusively via our career site, as this is the only way we can guarantee the protection of your data. You can find our privacy policy here.

About Us

Caspar Health is a digital rehabilitation clinic with a vision to provide patients with access to the most effective rehabilitation treatment at any time, any place.

Medical facilities use Caspar Health to conduct therapy measures online with their patients during their hospital stay and after discharge. The combination of learning technology with in-depth medical knowledge ensures that the therapy goal is achieved in a sustainable manner.

The services are covered by numerous pension insurance companies in the areas of rehabilitation, prevention and aftercare.
